name: Colosseum
description: Ancient amphitheater and iconic symbol of Imperial Rome. Famous for gladiator contests and public spectacles. One of the New Seven Wonders of the World.

name: Vatican Museums
description: World-renowned art collection including the Sistine Chapel. Home to masterpieces by Michelangelo, Raphael, and Bernini. Contains over 70,000 works of art.

name: Pantheon
description: Best-preserved Roman building with magnificent dome architecture. Former Roman temple now serving as a church. Features the famous oculus opening.

name: Trevi Fountain
description: Baroque fountain famous for coin-throwing tradition. Stunning nighttime illumination creates romantic atmosphere. Designed by Italian architect Nicola Salvi.

name: Roman Forum
description: Ancient ruins of the center of Roman public life. Archaeological site with temples, basilicas, and government buildings. Walking through history.

name: Spanish Steps
description: Famous stairway with 135 steps connecting Piazza di Spagna to Trinità dei Monti. Popular meeting place and shopping area. Beautiful azaleas in spring.

name: Piazza Navona
description: Baroque square built on ancient Roman stadium. Features three magnificent fountains including Bernini's Fountain of Four Rivers. Street artists and cafes.

name: Castel Sant'Angelo
description: Towering cylindrical building originally built as mausoleum for Emperor Hadrian. Papal fortress with panoramic city views. Rich museum collection.

name: Trastevere
description: Charming neighborhood with narrow cobblestone streets and authentic Roman atmosphere. Excellent restaurants and vibrant nightlife. Medieval churches and local markets.

name: Villa Borghese
description: Large public park with museums, gardens, and recreational activities. Houses Borghese Gallery with Bernini sculptures. Perfect for families and picnics.

name: Campo de' Fiori
description: Lively square with morning market selling fresh produce and flowers. Transforms into nightlife hotspot with bars and restaurants. Historic statue of Giordano Bruno.

name: Palatine Hill
description: Archaeological site with ruins of imperial palaces. Legendary birthplace of Rome with stunning views over the Forum. Beautiful gardens and museum.

name: Capitoline Museums
description: World's oldest public museums with incredible ancient Roman sculptures. Houses the original Marcus Aurelius statue. Designed by Michelangelo.

name: Baths of Caracalla
description: Ancient Roman public baths remarkably well-preserved. Engineering marvel with sophisticated heating system. Hosts summer opera performances.

name: Piazza del Popolo
description: Grand square with twin churches and Egyptian obelisk. Gateway to Rome from the north. Climb Pincio Hill for panoramic views.

name: Testaccio Market
description: Authentic food market beloved by locals. Fresh ingredients and traditional Roman street food. Great place to experience local culinary culture.

name: Aventine Hill
description: Peaceful residential area with beautiful gardens and churches. Famous keyhole view of St. Peter's Dome. Orange garden with romantic sunset views.

name: Largo di Torre Argentina
description: Archaeological site with four Roman temples. Famous cat sanctuary with hundreds of stray cats. Historical significance as Julius Caesar's assassination site.

name: Janiculum Hill
description: Highest hill in Rome with spectacular panoramic views. Daily cannon firing at noon. Monument to Giuseppe Garibaldi and beautiful pine trees.

name: Ostia Antica
description: Ancient Roman port city with well-preserved ruins. Less crowded alternative to Pompeii. Beautiful mosaics and ancient theater still in use.

name: Mercati di Traiano
description: Ancient Roman shopping complex considered the world's first mall. Interactive museum with multimedia displays. Archaeological wonder with original Roman architecture.

name: Palazzo Altemps
description: Renaissance palace housing incredible ancient Roman sculptures. Part of National Roman Museum. Beautiful frescoed rooms and peaceful courtyard.

name: Crypta Balbi
description: Archaeological museum showing medieval Rome's transformation. Underground excavations reveal layers of history. Part of National Roman Museum complex.

name: Palazzo Massimo
description: Museum with extraordinary ancient Roman frescoes and mosaics. Houses the Boxer at Rest sculpture. Beautiful garden frescoes from Villa di Livia.

name: Centrale Montemartini
description: Unique museum displaying ancient sculptures in former power plant. Striking contrast between classical art and industrial architecture. Off-the-beaten-path cultural gem.

name: Galleria Borghese
description: Intimate museum with Bernini sculptures and Caravaggio paintings. Requires advance booking. Located in beautiful Villa Borghese park.

name: Santa Maria in Trastevere
description: Beautiful medieval church with golden mosaics. One of Rome's oldest churches. Charming piazza perfect for evening aperitivo.

name: Appian Way
description: Ancient Roman road lined with ruins and catacombs. Perfect for cycling or walking. Rich archaeological heritage and peaceful countryside atmosphere.

name: Catacombs of San Callisto
description: Underground burial chambers with early Christian frescoes. Historical significance for early Christianity. Guided tours reveal fascinating history.

name: Isola Tiberina
description: Charming island in the Tiber River with ancient hospital and churches. Connected by ancient bridges. Peaceful retreat from city bustle.

name: Circus Maximus
description: Ancient Roman chariot racing stadium, now a large park. Historical site where 250,000 spectators once gathered. Great for jogging and events.

name: San Giovanni in Laterano
description: The Pope's cathedral and mother church of all Catholic churches worldwide. Magnificent baroque interior with stunning mosaics. Contains the Holy Stairs climbed by Jesus.

name: Santa Maria Maggiore
description: Papal basilica with the world's largest Marian icon. Beautiful 5th-century mosaics and coffered ceiling with New World gold. Legend says it was built where snow fell in August.

name: Domus Aurea
description: Nero's opulent golden palace with virtual reality tours. Underground archaeological wonder with original Roman frescoes. Revolutionary multimedia experience brings ancient Rome to life.

name: Quartiere Coppedè
description: Fairy-tale neighborhood with Art Nouveau architecture and whimsical buildings. Hidden gem with ornate facades and magical atmosphere. Perfect for Instagram photos.

name: Bocca della Verità
description: Ancient marble mask famous from Roman Holiday movie. Legend says it bites the hands of liars. Located in beautiful Santa Maria in Cosmedin church.

name: EUR District
description: Fascist-era architectural complex with monumental buildings and wide boulevards. Modern Rome with museums, shopping, and distinctive rationalist architecture. Less touristy but historically significant.

name: Palazzo dei Congressi
description: Iconic EUR building known as the Square Colosseum. Stark white travertine facade with repetitive arches. Symbol of Mussolini's architectural vision.

name: Villa Adriana
description: Emperor Hadrian's vast villa complex in nearby Tivoli. UNESCO World Heritage site with pools, libraries, and theaters. Architectural masterpiece showcasing Roman engineering.

name: Villa d'Este
description: Renaissance villa in Tivoli with spectacular fountains and gardens. Terraced landscape with water features and grottos. Perfect example of Italian Renaissance garden design.

name: Castel Gandolfo
description: Papal summer residence overlooking Lake Albano. Charming hilltop town with papal gardens and astronomical observatory. Beautiful lake views and peaceful atmosphere.

name: Frascati
description: Historic town in Alban Hills famous for white wine. Beautiful villas and vineyards with panoramic views of Rome. Traditional porchetta and local wine tastings.

name: Ponte Sant'Angelo
description: Ancient bridge adorned with Bernini's angel sculptures. Connects city center to Castel Sant'Angelo. Stunning sunset views and romantic evening strolls.

name: Piazza Venezia
description: Grand square dominated by the massive Vittoriano monument. Central hub connecting major Roman sites. Busy traffic circle with historical significance.

name: Altare della Patria
description: Monumental building honoring Victor Emmanuel II. Nicknamed the 'Wedding Cake' for its white marble layers. Panoramic elevator to the top with city views.

name: San Clemente
description: Unique three-level church revealing 2000 years of history. Underground Mithraic temple and medieval frescoes. Archaeological marvel in layers beneath modern Rome.

name: Santa Prassede
description: Small church with Byzantine mosaics rivaling those in Istanbul. Hidden gem with Chapel of St. Zeno covered in gold mosaics. Medieval artistic masterpiece.

name: Terme di Diocleziano
description: Ancient Roman baths converted into museum and church. Massive ruins showcase Roman bathing culture. Part of National Roman Museum with incredible sculptures.

name: Porta Portese Market
description: Rome's largest flea market held every Sunday morning. Treasure hunt for antiques, vintage items, and local crafts. Authentic Roman market experience.

name: Garbatella
description: Charming early 20th-century neighborhood with garden city architecture. Authentic Roman community with local markets and trattorias. Off-the-beaten-path residential area.

name: Pigneto
description: Hip neighborhood with street art, craft beer bars, and independent restaurants. Former working-class area now trendy with young Romans. Vibrant nightlife scene.

name: Monti
description: Bohemian neighborhood with vintage shops, wine bars, and artisan boutiques. Medieval streets with modern Roman lifestyle. Perfect for evening aperitivo.

name: San Lorenzo
description: University district with student bars, pizzerias, and alternative culture. Bohemian atmosphere with street art and live music venues. Authentic Roman nightlife.

name: Ostiense
description: Former industrial area transformed into cultural district. Contemporary art galleries, clubs, and creative spaces. Rome's alternative culture hub.

name: Flaminio
description: Modern district with contemporary architecture and cultural venues. MAXXI museum and Auditorium Parco della Musica. Rome's modern face.

name: MAXXI
description: National Museum of 21st Century Arts with cutting-edge architecture by Zaha Hadid. Contemporary art exhibitions and innovative design. Rome's modern cultural beacon.

name: Auditorium Parco della Musica
description: World-class concert hall complex designed by Renzo Piano. Three distinctive beetle-shaped halls hosting international performances. Rome's premier music venue.

name: Stadio Olimpico
description: Rome's main stadium hosting AS Roma and SS Lazio football matches. Historic venue for 1960 Olympics and 1990 World Cup. Electric atmosphere during Rome derby.

name: Foro Italico
description: Sports complex built during fascist era with monumental architecture. Includes tennis courts, swimming pools, and marble statues. Hosts Italian Open tennis tournament.

name: Ponte Milvio
description: Ancient bridge where couples attach love locks. Romantic tradition with thousands of padlocks. Beautiful views of Tiber River and northern Rome.

name: Villa Giulia
description: Etruscan museum housed in beautiful Renaissance villa. Extensive collection of pre-Roman artifacts. Peaceful gardens and archaeological treasures.

name: Palazzo Altemps
description: Renaissance palace with incredible ancient Roman sculpture collection. Beautiful frescoed rooms and peaceful internal courtyard. Part of National Roman Museum.

name: Cripta Neroniana
description: Underground tunnel connecting Palatine Hill to Domus Aurea. Recently opened archaeological site with original Roman frescoes. Limited access guided tours.

name: Santa Maria sopra Minerva
description: Rome's only Gothic church with Michelangelo's Risen Christ sculpture. Beautiful star-studded ceiling and Renaissance art. Elephant obelisk in front piazza.

name: Il Gesù
description: Mother church of the Jesuits with spectacular baroque interior. Stunning ceiling frescoes and St. Ignatius tomb. Important Counter-Reformation architecture.

name: Sant'Ignazio
description: Jesuit church with incredible trompe-l'oeil ceiling creating illusion of dome. Masterpiece of baroque art and optical illusion. Andrea Pozzo's artistic genius.

name: San Luigi dei Francesi
description: French national church containing three Caravaggio paintings. Stunning baroque interior with masterpieces by the revolutionary artist. Art lover's pilgrimage site.

name: Santa Maria del Popolo
description: Renaissance church with Caravaggio's Conversion of St. Paul and Crucifixion of St. Peter. Bernini's Chigi Chapel and Pinturicchio frescoes.

name: Sant'Agostino
description: Renaissance church housing Caravaggio's Madonna of Loreto. Sansovino's Madonna del Parto and beautiful Renaissance architecture. Hidden artistic treasures.

name: San Carlo alle Quattro Fontane
description: Borromini's masterpiece of baroque architecture with undulating walls. Tiny church showing genius of space manipulation. Architectural innovation at its finest.

name: Sant'Ivo alla Sapienza
description: Borromini's architectural masterpiece with innovative spiral lantern. Complex geometry and revolutionary baroque design. Hidden courtyard gem.

name: Santa Maria della Vittoria
description: Baroque church famous for Bernini's Ecstasy of St. Teresa sculpture. Cornaro Chapel considered masterpiece of baroque art. Dramatic lighting and emotional expression.

name: San Pietro in Vincoli
description: Church housing Michelangelo's Moses sculpture. Chains that bound St. Peter displayed in reliquary. Renaissance art in intimate setting.

name: Santa Sabina
description: Early Christian basilica on Aventine Hill with original wooden doors. Peaceful Dominican monastery with orange garden. Stunning views over Rome.

name: Giardino degli Aranci
description: Orange garden on Aventine Hill with romantic sunset views. Peaceful park with panoramic vista of St. Peter's dome. Perfect for romantic walks.

name: Keyhole of Malta
description: Famous keyhole view perfectly framing St. Peter's Basilica. Magical optical illusion through garden hedge. Most photographed keyhole in the world.

name: Protestant Cemetery
description: Peaceful cemetery where Keats and Shelley are buried. Beautiful cypress trees and romantic atmosphere. Literary pilgrimage site.

name: Pyramid of Cestius
description: Ancient Roman pyramid built as tomb for magistrate Gaius Cestius. Unusual Egyptian-inspired monument in Rome. Adjacent to Protestant Cemetery.

name: Monte Testaccio
description: Artificial hill made from ancient Roman pottery shards. Archaeological wonder built from discarded amphora. Unique testament to Roman commerce.

name: Centrale Montemartini
description: Ancient Roman sculptures displayed in former power plant. Striking juxtaposition of classical art and industrial machinery. Unique museum experience.

name: MACRO
description: Contemporary art museum in former Peroni brewery. Cutting-edge exhibitions and innovative installations. Rome's modern art scene.

name: Palazzo Braschi
description: Neoclassical palace housing Rome's history museum. Beautiful architecture and historical artifacts. Papal family's grand residence.

name: Palazzo Quirinale
description: Official residence of Italian President. Former papal palace with stunning gardens and state rooms. Limited public access but magnificent architecture.

name: Palazzo di Giustizia
description: Imposing courthouse known as 'Il Palazzaccio' for its massive size. Eclectic architecture with bronze quadriga on top. Symbol of Italian justice system.

name: Galleria Nazionale d'Arte Moderna
description: Italy's premier modern art museum with 19th and 20th century works. Beautiful villa setting with contemporary Italian art. Overlooking Villa Borghese.

name: Etruscan Museum
description: Villa Giulia houses world's finest Etruscan collection. Pre-Roman civilization artifacts and beautiful Renaissance villa. Archaeological treasures and peaceful gardens.

name: Bioparco
description: Rome's zoo located in Villa Borghese with over 1,000 animals. Family-friendly attraction with conservation focus. Educational programs and children's areas.

name: Explora Children's Museum
description: Interactive museum designed for children under 12. Hands-on exhibits about science, environment, and society. Perfect family activity with educational fun.

name: Villa Torlonia
description: Neoclassical villa with beautiful parks and museums. Former Mussolini residence with art nouveau Casino delle Civette. Peaceful alternative to Villa Borghese.

name: Casino delle Civette
description: Art nouveau fairy-tale house with owl-themed decorations. Stained glass windows and whimsical architecture. Hidden gem in Villa Torlonia.

name: Quartiere Salario
description: Residential area with Villa Ada park and trendy restaurants. Mix of early 20th century and modern architecture. Less touristy with authentic Roman life.

name: Villa Ada
description: Large public park with walking trails, lakes, and sports facilities. Former royal residence with beautiful nature. Popular for jogging and outdoor activities.

name: Catacombe di Priscilla
description: Underground burial complex known as 'Queen of Catacombs'. Early Christian frescoes including oldest known image of Virgin Mary. Fascinating historical site.

name: Quartiere Trieste
description: Elegant early 20th century neighborhood with Liberty style buildings. Upscale residential area with beautiful architecture. Less touristy with authentic charm.
